findings.title: Outdated compiler
findings.description: Using outdated compiler version 0.6.11, which is very outdated and can lead to security issues.

findings.title: Use of optimizer
findings.description: Optimizer can contain bugs and it could lead to unexpected behavior or even vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Use of uint256 where uint8 is enough
findings.description: Using uint256 instead of uint8 can waste gas and has no security implications.

findings.title: Variable packing
findings.description: State variables could have a more optimal ordering to save gas using variable packing (32 bytes).

findings.title: Unlimited allowance
findings.description: Contract sets allowance for a router and a staking pool to uint256 max value, which could lead to unlimited drain of funds in case the router or the staking pool gets hacked.

findings.title: Renounce ownership
findings.description: Open Zeppelin's Ownable pattern allows the current owner to renounce the ownership of the contract, which could potentially cause inability to call pause(), unpause() and adminFeeWithdraw() methods.
